title: Eugene O'Neill - Nobel Prize in Literature, 1936 (13 books)
description:
EUGENE O'NEILL (1888-1953) was an American playwright and four-time winner of the Pulitzer Prize.  He was awarded the 1936 Nobel Prize in Literature "for the power, honesty and deep-felt emotions of his dramatic works, which embody an original concept of tragedy."

O'Neill helped to introduce into American drama techniques of realism earlier associated with Chekhov, Ibsen, and Strindberg.  His plays were among the first to include speeches in American vernacular and involve characters on the fringes of society, where they struggle to maintain their hopes and aspirations, but ultimately slide into disillusionment and despair.  Nearly all of his plays involve some degree of tragedy and personal pessimism.  LONG DAY'S JOURNEY INTO NIGHT (1956), widely considered to be his masterwork, is often numbered on the short list of being among the finest American plays in the 20th century alongside "A Streetcar Named Desire" and "Death of a Salesman".

Anchored by the first two volumes of the marvellous Library of America edition, and with the sole exception of "The Calms of Capricorn", this collection includes all 50 of O'Neill's full-length and one-act plays.


The following books are in PDF or ePUB format as indicated:

* COMPLETE PLAYS, 1913-1920 (Library of America, 1988).  Edited by Travis Bogard. -- PDF

* COMPLETE PLAYS, 1920-1931 (Library of America, 1988).  Edited by Travis Bogard. -- PDF

* EARLY PLAYS (Penguin, 2001).  Edited with an Introduction by Jeffrey H. Richards. -- ePUB

* EXORCISM: A Play in One Act (Yale UP, 2012).  Foreword by Edward Albee. -- ePUB

* FOUR PLAYS: Beyond the Horizon / Anna Christie / The Emperor Jones / The Hairy Ape (Signet, 2007). -- ePUB

* THE ICEMAN COMETH (Yale UP, 2006).  Foreword by Harold Bloom. -- ePUB

* THE LATER PLAYS OF EUGENE O'NEILL (Modern Library, 1967) -- PDF

* LONG DAY'S JOURNEY INTO NIGHT (Yale UP, 2002).  Second edition.  Foreword by Harold Bloom. -- ePUB

* LONG DAY'S JOURNEY INTO NIGHT: Critical Edition (Yale UP, 2014).  Edited by William Davies King. -- ePUB

* A MOON FOR THE MISBEGOTTEN (Yale UP, 2006).  Introduction by Stephen A. Black. -- ePUB

* MORE STATELY MANSIONS (Yale UP, 1964) -- PDF

* MOURNING BECOMES ELECTRA: A Trilogy (Adelaide, 2010) -- ePUB

* THE PLAYS OF EUGENE O'NEILL, Vol. III (Random House, 1964) -- PDF
